agent_utterance: It's a hot Monday in Suwon. Let's keep this ultra-simple: in the next 2 minutes, drink a cool glass of water (about 200–250 ml) and take 4 slow, deep breaths. After that, quickly rate your hunger and energy on a 0–10 scale to guide your next tiny move. If your hunger score is 3 or higher, have a small, easy snack (like a grape or a yogurt); if it's lower, stay hydrated and proceed with your day.

agent_utterance: Here are ultra-simple, stomach-friendly snack ideas you can start with now (small portions): - 1 small banana or half a banana; - 1 small cup plain yogurt (or lactose-free) with a tiny drizzle of honey if you like; - 1/2 cup applesauce; - 1 rice cake topped with a thin layer of jam; - 4–6 grapes; - 1 small slice dry toast or cracker with a light spread of honey or yogurt; - a small bowl of plain oatmeal made with water; - sips of water or an electrolyte drink if helpful. Remember to keep portions small and go slow. If your stomach feels off, choose the gentlest option and pause.
